text: it was some extremely frightening
because we had no warning about the
floods and how it would affect us we
live in an area called Gorky Park which
is next to ROG Park and these areas have
been hit the worst the night before we
were actually flooded we rang up the
chief engineer to ask if there was any
danger and we were told no worries just
stay put in the morning we left about
half past 10:00 and it was a panic leave
because though we could see the water
coming down the road and as we left we
were actually hit by the river and we
just barely escaped there's just a whole
river coming into that area and I think
if we had been about a minute later we
too would have been stuck there it was
an extremely frightening experience and
the worst of it is that there was no
warning there was no planning there was
no all the people were just complacently
sitting saying yes we've been told
everything is okay I think they could
have at least warned the local people to
move out they had plenty of opportunity
I mean it's a small area they could have
gone around with megaphone saying this
area is no longer safe get out and the
radio was working everything was working
you know until the floods happened they
could have easily warned the people to
get out of those areas because they're
right next to the river the the local
authority has been totally incompetent
in looking after its population can you
tell us refit rabu what the
communication system is like at the
moment I do understand that your sister
and brother-in-law are still in ensuring
ago there is no communication the
communications were completely cut down
on Sunday around 4 o'clock and even at
that time the telephone connection was
lost in fact I hardly spoke to my sister
as she just told me that she was okay
and she could not get out and that's all
I could hear
